body: • An article about the latest statistics from the Ministry of Justice on deaths, self-harm and assaults in prison custody in England and Wales (Prisons ‘in meltdown’ as suicides hit highest for 25 years, 29 April, page 6) attributed a quote to “an MoJ spokesperson”. The words were actually those of the prisons minister, Andrew Selous. The error originated in an email from the Ministry of Justice, which later pointed out its mistake. • The chairman of Lewisham’s stop and search community monitoring group is Emmanuel Imuere, not Amuere (Victims of a ‘brute madness’ on the streets, 15 April, page 1). • A person who owns or runs a restaurant is a restaurateur, not a restauranteur as we had it (Ivy owner Caring got £93m BHS payout, 29 April, page 4). • Malapropism corner: “By flaunting the government’s building regulations, the builder is disqualified from receiving reconstruction aid” (Earthquake survivors left stranded in Nepal as red tape stops aid flowing, 25 April, theguardian.com).
